message.content: To update an iframe without refreshing the entire page, you can use JavaScript to dynamically change the source of the iframe or manipulate its content. Here's how you can do it: ### Method 1: Changing the `src` Attribute If you want to load a new URL into the iframe, you can simply change its `src` attribute. Here's an example: ```html Update Iframe Example ``` In this example, clicking the "Update Iframe" button will change the content of the iframe to `new-page.html`. ### Method 2: Using `contentWindow` to Modify Content If you need more control over the iframe's content without reloading it, you can use the `contentWindow` property to access and modify the iframe's document directly. Here's an example: ```html Update Iframe Content Example ``` In this case, clicking the "Update Iframe Content" button will replace the content of the iframe with new HTML content. Both methods allow you to update the iframe without affecting the rest of the page, providing a seamless user experience. @EOF@ [iframe, JavaScript, src attribute, contentWindow, dynamic content, HTML, web development]
